meanings.sent1: The loud alarm was deterrable, scaring away the intruders.
meanings.sent2: Locks on doors are deterrable, preventing burglaries.
meanings.sent3: The deterrable guard dog barked at the mailman, thinking he was a thief.
meanings.sent4: Her determined attitude was deterrable, keeping her focused on her goals.
meanings.sent5: The deterrable warning sign made drivers slow down near the school.

meanings.definition: Able to be discouraged or prevented.
meanings.sent1: The deterrable raincoat kept her dry during the storm.
meanings.sent2: Studying consistently is deterrable to failing exams.
meanings.sent3: The deterrable cat refused to eat the new brand of food.
meanings.sent4: His deterrable excuses for being late were getting old with his boss.
meanings.sent5: The deterrable fence stopped the dog from digging under it.
